Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Electro-magnetic \E*lec`tro-mag*net"ic\, a. Of or pertaining to {electromagnetism}. [1913 Webster]
{Electro-magnetic engine}, an engine in which the motive force is electro-magnetism.
{Electro-magnetic theory of light} (Physics), a theory of light which makes it consist in the rapid alternation of transient electric currents moving transversely to the direction of the ray. [1913 Webster]
electromagnetic adj : pertaining to or exhibiting magnetism produced by electric charge in motion; "electromagnetic energy"
